Executive Summary for the Erie County Water Authority Sturgeon Point and Van de Water-Water Treatment Plants.   



Accident Release Prevention Policy: The Authority will take every reasonable action to prevent all accidental releases. This is accomplished by using the most current design, training, and inspecting processes available. The Authority's prevented maintenance program includes

1)    Having an analysis of the scrubber media tested twice per year, to verify the scrubber chlorine neutralization capacity.

2)     The Halogen eclipse automatic shutoff valves are factory tested yearly 

3)     Gas detectors are tested weekly. 

4)    Chlorine flexible lines and Header valves from the tank to the manifold are replaced yearly.



Operating and maintenance procedures are reviewed annually and are officially approved as the accepted operating procedures. 

Personnel are trained on operation and maintenance procedures annually.

The Stationary Source for Chlorine (CAS No. 7782-50-5) remains the same since the original RMP 1999

nario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp and Marplot) with a radius of 3.0 miles for a rural area. The Alternative Release Scenario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp and Marplot) with radius of 1.9 miles for a rural area.  



Sturgeon Point

The Fire Chief and volunteers of the Highland Hose Volunteer Fire Company, Evans NY  annually reviews and  inspects the Sturgeon Point treatment plant last visit October 2016



Sturgeon Point Maintenance Updates 2015-2016

1) Chlorine detector located in the cylinder supply area was relocated closer in the cylinders

2) Crane stops on the chlorine crane were re-position to avoid crane from contacting chlorine piping.

3) Erie County Emergency Services requested signs posting for Empty and Full cylinders in chlorine supply.

4) Standardize on opening cylinder valves using a 6" twisted wrench approved by chlorine institute.

5) A detail procedure on replacing chlorine piping by purging with Nitrogen.

Sturgeon Point Equipment

In 2016 the ECWA installed a central Fire/Chlorine alarm system in its main facility. Progress in  2017 is to complete installation of the Fire /Chlorine alarm in remaining buildings. The Fire /Chlorine Alarm system will alert plant personnel of a release and to evacuate the area.
